summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of West Fifty-sixth Street, and West Fifty-seventh Street, each from Ninth Avenue Northwest to Eleventh Avenue Northwest; and West Fifty-eighth Street, from Eighth Avenue Northwest to Eleventh Avenue Northwest, all in The City of Seattle, by constructing sewers therein or proper dimensions and materials, together with all manholes, flush tanks, catch basins and other appurtenances necessary for the proper sewering and draining of said district, in accordance with Resolution No. 1485 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
